claim: The artist Aaron Boyd has illustrated 12 different types of cards.
reasoning: Aaron Boyd has illustrated cards with only 2 distinct types (Creature and Instant), not 12. Even using the full type line (which includes subtypes), there are only 4 distinct values. The claim of 12 different types is contradicted by the data.

content.text: I can see there's a `types` column and an `artist` column. The claim is about "different types of cards" illustrated by Aaron Boyd. Let me query this.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT types FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Get distinct types for Aaron Boyd

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT types) FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Count distinct types for Aaron Boyd

content.text:
Aaron Boyd has illustrated only **2** distinct types of cards (`Creature` and `Instant`), not 12 as the claim states.

Let me also check if there could be other type-related columns that might be relevant:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT type FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Check distinct 'type' (full type line) for Aaron Boyd

content.content:
Creature — Bird
Instant
Creature — Cat
Creature — Kavu

content.text:
Even using the full `type` column (which includes subtypes), there are only 4 distinct values. The claim of 12 is clearly contradicted.
